title: Yasuo W fails to block Annie Q

embed.description: Annie's W and R aren't projectiles, but her Q is definitely a projectile and should therefore be destroyed on contact with Yasuo's W. And yet, poor Yasuo used W correctly only to watch as Annie's Q went right through it, stunned him, and got him killed.

body: I cast Annie Q at a Yasuo yesterday, and he tried to windwall it. We both thought the wall would block the projectile, but my Q went right through, damaging and stunning him. It's a projectile, so the expected behavior would be that the wall destroys it, but it didn't.

replies.body: Annie{{champion:1}}  Q is not a skill shot. So i do not believe yasuo{{champion:157}}  wind wall will block it. But i could be wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=Rose Vertigo,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=V9Jqwqdl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-04T22:04:34.976+0000)
>
> Annie{{champion:1}}  Q is not a skill shot. So i do not believe yasuo{{champion:157}}  wind wall will block it. But i could be wrong.

Interception effects only look at whether the incoming damage is a projectile. This includes Ashe W (skillshot), Ryze E (targeted), many ranged autoattacks (targeted), and so on. Skillshot vs targeted is not a factor. Annie's Q definitely has a projectile which should therefore be destroyed by this effect.
